lua: Writing a module contains classes

published at:
2016-01-18

I want to write 2 or more classes into a module by Lua.
One class is private, another one is public, but I donâ€™t know how to write that module properly.
So, I have been assumed to make some codes to study that ways.

 1 --
 2 -- animals.lua
 3 --
 4 
 5 local m = {}
 6 
 7 --
 8 -- private class Animal
 9 --
10 local Animal = function(_name)
11    local self = setmetatable({
12       name = _name
13    }, {__index = {}})
14    function self:get_name()
15       return self.name
16    end
17    return self
18 end
19 
20 --
21 -- public class Dog extends Animal
22 --
23 m.Dog = function(_name)
24    local self = Animal(_name)
25    function self:cry()
26       return "wan-wan"
27    end
28    return self
29 end
30 
31 return m

The resulte is here:

 1 --
 2 -- main.lua
 3 --
 4 local animals = require 'animals'
 5 
 6 ----[[
 7 local dog1 = animals.Dog("pochi")
 8 print(dog1:get_name()) --=> 'pochi'
 9 print(dog1:cry())  --=> 'wan-wan'
10 --]]--

Unfortunately, I have no skills make sure this module is collect.
These codes could cause some problems relevant to performance and inheritance classes so on.
